title: Ticket #5903: Fix RESCHEDULE command sent to schedd after job submission
description:
In order for the schedd to promptly handle a newly-submitted job, the submitter should send a RESCHEDULE command to the schedd. Otherwise, the job may sit idle for many minutes, even if there are resources available to run it immediately.

We've found two issues that foil this way to have the schedd promptly handle a new job:

  • The Job Router doesn't send a RESCHEDULE.
  • The DCSchedd object always sends RESCHEDULE via UDP, even if the schedd can't accept UDP messages (e.g. it's using shared port).
remarks:
2016-Sep-29 10:39:00 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Code review is good, as now the job router simply does the exact same thing as condor_submit. Only criticism of the patch is the version history entry is written like it is targeted to a developer (i.e. something appropriate for a git commit message), and not targeted for an end-user.

A couple potential thoughts for the future (and for a separate tickets) come to mind:

  1. the schedd should automatically do a reschedule at controlled intervals whenever a job moves into the idle state, thus rescheduling whenever

  2. even with shared_port, seems like daemons other than the shadow and starter could have a UDP command socket enabled for intra-machine communication.
